page.title: 10GROBY WOMENS INSTITUTE.
page.content: The Womens Institute is a flourishing group comprising 62 members.They range in age from 15 to 83.The group is one of the 200 in Leicestershire.Meetings are held once a month in the village hall and usually begin with the singing of 'Jerusalem'.The minutes of the previous meeting are then read and any matters arising dealt with.A discussion follows on forthcoming events and on the county newsletter which lists courses and competitions. Quite often there is then an outside speaker who may illustrate their talk with slides.This is followed by a 20 minute break for refreshments.The meeting ends with a 'social half hour',when there may be a competition or a game such as Bingo or Beetle may be played.
